column1: The Dutch government just announced new measures to try and fight the new corona virus.These new measures have an impact on tourists and tourism, that’s why I decided to open a new topic.Effective immediately until March 31, 2020 events with >100 visitors throughout the entire country are CANCELLED. This includes museums, theatres, concerts, sport events.

Please note that these measures are in place until March 31, 2020. It’s not yet known what will happen after March 31, 2020.However there are already some events cancelled that were to take place after April 1, 2020. These events include the Marathon of Rotterdam on April 5 and the Marathon of Utrecht on April 19, as well as several other smaller running events.
Do you have a link to a news site with this info?
Some of the points mentioned by BTG are in this article.https:/…
Thank you

The website of the Dutch National Institute for Public Health and the Environment is the official source for all communications. They have an English version of their website, but since news is just released, they weren’t yet able to update their websitehttps://www.rivm.nl/enThe website of the Dutch government has an overview of all the measures. This also is in Dutch, but Google Translate will do the trickhttps://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/cor…
Rijksmuseum just announced they will close at least until 31 March. No news from other museums yet.
The Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum have just announced they will be CLOSED until March 31, 2020Edited: 11:57 am, March 12, 2020
Same for Mauritshuis,
Thank you very much for this update.
The Anne Frank house, the Hermitage Amsterdam and the Stedelijk museum have also announced they will stay closed Until April 1, 2020.
The English version of the website of the Dutch government has now been updated with the latest new measures;https://www.government.nl/topics/coronavirus…
The Heineken Experience is closed as well. Adam Lookout remains open, but will limit visitors to <100
So,does it mean that since it is a government mandate, we will get a refund of our tickets?

That is open to the individual business. Some will quickly give a refund, others will initially try to offer you a voucher for a future visit (hopefully valid for quite a few years and not just a few months). Hope the first group will be the majority...< Erik> & [Sandya]
See the websites of the museums you bought tickets for for details about refunds.
Nemo and Rembrandthuis will also be closed until the end of March. And unfortunately for the regulars here, the Museum of bags and purses will be closed as well.
The Kinderdijk windmills will also be closed.
The Keukenhof just announced they won’t open on March 21, 2020. They hope to be able to open on April 1, 2020.https://keukenhof.nl/en/opening-march-21/

Yesterday, the measures where extended to April 6 and all bars, restaurants, coffeeshops etc etc were told to close until April 6 as well.And now events that were scheduled to be held after April 6 are started to get cancelled as well; the Kingsday celebration in Maastricht that was to be attented by The Royal Family, the 538 Kingsday concert in Breda and several other events. This isn’t over yet, and before it is, much more events will get cancelled.Edited: 12:58 pm, March 16, 2020
This week it is also expected that it will be announced that the Euro2020 football championships will be moved to 2021. But is not sure yet.
